metadata.title: CVE-2019-11091 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Microarchitectural Data Sampling Uncacheable Memory (MDSUM): Uncacheablememory on some microprocessors utilizing speculative execution may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a sidechannel with local access. A list of impacted products can be found here:https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/corporate-information/SA00233-microcode-update-guidance_05132019.pdf

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11091` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9

No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu1').
